Pre-Game Insights: Iceland have kept clean sheets in 50% of their last six competitive matches.
Montenegro have failed to score in three of their last six games.
Seven of Iceland’s last ten home fixtures have featured under 2.5 goals.
Iceland’s pragmatic approach, particularly at home, has often led to tight games with few goals.
Montenegro’s reliance on key players like Stevan Jovetic and Stefan Mugosa means that when these individuals do not perform, the team’s attacking threat diminishes considerably.
Both Iceland and Montenegro have shown a pattern of low-scoring games.
Iceland’s ability to frustrate stronger teams, such as their 1-0 win over England earlier this year, demonstrates their capacity to grind out results.
